metadata.title: CVE-2017-7542 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
The ip6_find_1stfragopt function in net/ipv6/output_core.c in the Linuxkernel through 4.12.3 allows local users to cause a denial of service(integer overflow and infinite loop) by leveraging the ability to open araw socket.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7542` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.13.0-16-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.13.0-16-generic-lpae - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.13.0-16-lowlatency - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-16-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-1005-raspi2 - 4.13.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1001-aws - 4.15.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1002-azure - 4.15.0-1002.2
linux-image-extra-4.15.0-1002-azure - 4.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1001-gcp - 4.15.0-1001.1
linux-image-extra-4.15.0-1001-gcp - 4.15.0-1001.1

No subscription required
